Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/abs
Synopsis Absolute value of a numeric value.
Function &T <: num abs(&T <: num n)
Description Absolute value of the number n. The result type is equal to the type of the argument n.
Examples 
rascal>import Number;
ok
rascal>abs(13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(-13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(3.14)
real: 3.14
rascal>abs(-3.14)
real: 3.14

Questions
Question [1].
The type of abs(-3) is

Question [2].
The type of abs(-15.181194921609071200) is

Question [3]. 
abs(-14) ==

Question [4]. 
abs(-13.35646182472059590) ==
